Text.Language: Anok nim qa pie~bi/n: para ouon niben et hijen pikahi: eyricaji m~petaio: Maria t~seri n~Iwakim.
Who am I / the weakest of all those upon the earth / to speak of your honor / O Mary, the daughter of Joachim?

Apilogoc pid/miourgoc: i~ af[icarx e~bol n~q/]: a~remici m~mof e~reoi m~paryenoc: Maria t~seri n~Iwakim.
The Logos, the Creator, has come; / He was incarnate of you / and you gave birth to Him / while remaining a virgin / O Mary, the daughter of Joachim.

Barachiah has spoken of you / saying, â€œO True East / from whence Christ has shined upon usâ€? / O Mary, the daughter of Joachim.

Bakt/ria acviri e~bol: ,wric [o nem t~co: acswpi n~tupoc n~]paryenoc: Maria t~seri n~Iwakim.
The rod that blossomed / without planting or watering / has become a type of the Virgin / O Mary, the daughter of Joachim.

Genoc t/rf n~te ]metrwmi: nem nitagma n~te p~[ici: a~re[ici n~yo e~hote rwou t/rou: Maria t~seri n~Iwakim.
All races of mankind / and the orders on high â€” / you have been raised much higher than all of them, O Mary, the daughter of Joachim.

Ge gar Po#c# pia~nar,oc: afcwtp m~mo n~ouy~ronoc naf: w~]selet m~paradoxon: Maria t~seri n~Iwakim.
For the Lord who has no beginning / has chosen you to be His throne / a bride imbued with paradox / O Mary, the daughter of Joachim.

Dauid pejaf je a~ Po#c# V]: cwtp n~Ciwn naf m~manswpi: Ciwn gar te ]paryenoc: Maria t~seri n~Iwakim.
David has said, â€œThe Lord God chose Zion / to be His dwelling,â€? / for Zion is the Virgin / O Mary, the daughter of Joachim.

Dani/l afmou] e~ro: je pitwou n~no/~ron: n~yo pe pitwou ettajr/out: Maria t~seri n~Iwakim.
Daniel has spoken of you, saying / â€œO conceptual mountain, you are the established mountain,â€? O Mary, the daughter of Joachim.

Adamâ€™s high status / and his ancient estate / Christ has restored to him / by you, O Mary, the daughter of Joachim.

Ere nim qen nicovoc: nikath/t nem nipictoc: e~te m~poujw n~ne makaricmoc: Maria t~seri n~Iwakim.
Who among the wise / the intelligent, and the faithful / does not speak of your blessedness / O Mary, the daughter of Joachim?
